   1 # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
   2 
   3 from cerberus import Validator, errors
   4 from cerberus.tests import assert_fail
   5 
   6 
   7 ValidationError = errors.ValidationError
   8 
   9 
  10 def test__error_1():
  11     v = Validator(schema={'foo': {'type': 'string'}})
  12     v.document = {'foo': 42}
  13     v._error('foo', errors.BAD_TYPE, 'string')
  14     error = v._errors[0]
  15     assert error.document_path == ('foo',)
  16     assert error.schema_path == ('foo', 'type')
  17     assert error.code == 0x24
  18     assert error.rule == 'type'
  19     assert error.constraint == 'string'
  20     assert error.value == 42
  21     assert error.info == ('string',)
  22     assert not error.is_group_error
  23     assert not error.is_logic_error
  24 
  25 
  26 def test__error_2():
  27     v = Validator(schema={'foo': {'keysrules': {'type': 'integer'}}})
  28     v.document = {'foo': {'0': 'bar'}}
  29     v._error('foo', errors.KEYSRULES, ())
  30     error = v._errors[0]
  31     assert error.document_path == ('foo',)
  32     assert error.schema_path == ('foo', 'keysrules')
  33     assert error.code == 0x83
  34     assert error.rule == 'keysrules'
  35     assert error.constraint == {'type': 'integer'}
  36     assert error.value == {'0': 'bar'}
  37     assert error.info == ((),)
  38     assert error.is_group_error
  39     assert not error.is_logic_error
  40 
  41 
  42 def test__error_3():
  43     valids = [
  44         {'type': 'string', 'regex': '0x[0-9a-f]{2}'},
  45         {'type': 'integer', 'min': 0, 'max': 255},
  46     ]
  47     v = Validator(schema={'foo': {'oneof': valids}})
  48     v.document = {'foo': '0x100'}
  49     v._error('foo', errors.ONEOF, (), 0, 2)
  50     error = v._errors[0]
  51     assert error.document_path == ('foo',)
  52     assert error.schema_path == ('foo', 'oneof')
  53     assert error.code == 0x92
  54     assert error.rule == 'oneof'
  55     assert error.constraint == valids
  56     assert error.value == '0x100'
  57     assert error.info == ((), 0, 2)
  58     assert error.is_group_error
  59     assert error.is_logic_error
  60 
  61 
  62 def test_error_tree_from_subschema(validator):
  63     schema = {'foo': {'schema': {'bar': {'type': 'string'}}}}
  64     document = {'foo': {'bar': 0}}
  65     assert_fail(document, schema, validator=validator)
  66     d_error_tree = validator.document_error_tree
  67     s_error_tree = validator.schema_error_tree
  68 
  69     assert 'foo' in d_error_tree
  70 
  71     assert len(d_error_tree['foo'].errors) == 1, d_error_tree['foo']
  72     assert d_error_tree['foo'].errors[0].code == errors.MAPPING_SCHEMA.code
  73     assert 'bar' in d_error_tree['foo']
  74     assert d_error_tree['foo']['bar'].errors[0].value == 0
  75     assert d_error_tree.fetch_errors_from(('foo', 'bar'))[0].value == 0
  76 
  77     assert 'foo' in s_error_tree
  78     assert 'schema' in s_error_tree['foo']
  79     assert 'bar' in s_error_tree['foo']['schema']
  80     assert 'type' in s_error_tree['foo']['schema']['bar']
  81     assert s_error_tree['foo']['schema']['bar']['type'].errors[0].value == 0
  82     assert (
  83         s_error_tree.fetch_errors_from(('foo', 'schema', 'bar', 'type'))[0].value == 0
  84     )
  85 
  86 
  87 def test_error_tree_from_anyof(validator):
  88     schema = {'foo': {'anyof': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'integer'}]}}
  89     document = {'foo': []}
  90     assert_fail(document, schema, validator=validator)
  91     d_error_tree = validator.document_error_tree
  92     s_error_tree = validator.schema_error_tree
  93     assert 'foo' in d_error_tree
  94     assert d_error_tree['foo'].errors[0].value == []
  95     assert 'foo' in s_error_tree
  96     assert 'anyof' in s_error_tree['foo']
  97     assert 0 in s_error_tree['foo']['anyof']
  98     assert 1 in s_error_tree['foo']['anyof']
  99     assert 'type' in s_error_tree['foo']['anyof'][0]
 100     assert s_error_tree['foo']['anyof'][0]['type'].errors[0].value == []
 101 
 102 
 103 def test_nested_error_paths(validator):
 104     schema = {
 105         'a_dict': {
 106             'keysrules': {'type': 'integer'},
 107             'valuesrules': {'regex': '[a-z]*'},
 108         },
 109         'a_list': {'schema': {'type': 'string', 'oneof_regex': ['[a-z]*$', '[A-Z]*']}},
 110     }
 111     document = {
 112         'a_dict': {0: 'abc', 'one': 'abc', 2: 'aBc', 'three': 'abC'},
 113         'a_list': [0, 'abc', 'abC'],
 114     }
 115     assert_fail(document, schema, validator=validator)
 116 
 117     _det = validator.document_error_tree
 118     _set = validator.schema_error_tree
 119 
 120     assert len(_det.errors) == 0
 121     assert len(_set.errors) == 0
 122 
 123     assert len(_det['a_dict'].errors) == 2
 124     assert len(_set['a_dict'].errors) == 0
 125 
 126     assert _det['a_dict'][0] is None
 127     assert len(_det['a_dict']['one'].errors) == 1
 128     assert len(_det['a_dict'][2].errors) == 1
 129     assert len(_det['a_dict']['three'].errors) == 2
 130 
 131     assert len(_set['a_dict']['keysrules'].errors) == 1
 132     assert len(_set['a_dict']['valuesrules'].errors) == 1
 133 
 134     assert len(_set['a_dict']['keysrules']['type'].errors) == 2
 135     assert len(_set['a_dict']['valuesrules']['regex'].errors) == 2
 136 
 137     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 138         ('a_dict', 'one'),
 139         ('a_dict', 'keysrules', 'type'),
 140         errors.BAD_TYPE.code,
 141         'type',
 142         'integer',
 143         'one',
 144         (),
 145     )
 146     assert _det['a_dict']['one'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 147     assert _set['a_dict']['keysrules']['type'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 148 
 149     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 150         ('a_dict', 2),
 151         ('a_dict', 'valuesrules', 'regex'),
 152         errors.REGEX_MISMATCH.code,
 153         'regex',
 154         '[a-z]*$',
 155         'aBc',
 156         (),
 157     )
 158     assert _det['a_dict'][2].errors[0] == _ref_err
 159     assert _set['a_dict']['valuesrules']['regex'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 160 
 161     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 162         ('a_dict', 'three'),
 163         ('a_dict', 'keysrules', 'type'),
 164         errors.BAD_TYPE.code,
 165         'type',
 166         'integer',
 167         'three',
 168         (),
 169     )
 170     assert _det['a_dict']['three'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 171     assert _set['a_dict']['keysrules']['type'].errors[1] == _ref_err
 172 
 173     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 174         ('a_dict', 'three'),
 175         ('a_dict', 'valuesrules', 'regex'),
 176         errors.REGEX_MISMATCH.code,
 177         'regex',
 178         '[a-z]*$',
 179         'abC',
 180         (),
 181     )
 182     assert _det['a_dict']['three'].errors[1] == _ref_err
 183     assert _set['a_dict']['valuesrules']['regex'].errors[1] == _ref_err
 184 
 185     assert len(_det['a_list'].errors) == 1
 186     assert len(_det['a_list'][0].errors) == 1
 187     assert _det['a_list'][1] is None
 188     assert len(_det['a_list'][2].errors) == 3
 189     assert len(_set['a_list'].errors) == 0
 190     assert len(_set['a_list']['schema'].errors) == 1
 191     assert len(_set['a_list']['schema']['type'].errors) == 1
 192     assert len(_set['a_list']['schema']['oneof'][0]['regex'].errors) == 1
 193     assert len(_set['a_list']['schema']['oneof'][1]['regex'].errors) == 1
 194 
 195     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 196         ('a_list', 0),
 197         ('a_list', 'schema', 'type'),
 198         errors.BAD_TYPE.code,
 199         'type',
 200         'string',
 201         0,
 202         (),
 203     )
 204     assert _det['a_list'][0].errors[0] == _ref_err
 205     assert _set['a_list']['schema']['type'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 206 
 207     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 208         ('a_list', 2),
 209         ('a_list', 'schema', 'oneof'),
 210         errors.ONEOF.code,
 211         'oneof',
 212         'irrelevant_at_this_point',
 213         'abC',
 214         (),
 215     )
 216     assert _det['a_list'][2].errors[0] == _ref_err
 217     assert _set['a_list']['schema']['oneof'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 218 
 219     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 220         ('a_list', 2),
 221         ('a_list', 'schema', 'oneof', 0, 'regex'),
 222         errors.REGEX_MISMATCH.code,
 223         'regex',
 224         '[a-z]*$',
 225         'abC',
 226         (),
 227     )
 228     assert _det['a_list'][2].errors[1] == _ref_err
 229     assert _set['a_list']['schema']['oneof'][0]['regex'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 230 
 231     _ref_err = ValidationError(
 232         ('a_list', 2),
 233         ('a_list', 'schema', 'oneof', 1, 'regex'),
 234         errors.REGEX_MISMATCH.code,
 235         'regex',
 236         '[a-z]*$',
 237         'abC',
 238         (),
 239     )
 240     assert _det['a_list'][2].errors[2] == _ref_err
 241     assert _set['a_list']['schema']['oneof'][1]['regex'].errors[0] == _ref_err
 242 
 243 
 244 def test_queries():
 245     schema = {'foo': {'type': 'dict', 'schema': {'bar': {'type': 'number'}}}}
 246     document = {'foo': {'bar': 'zero'}}
 247     validator = Validator(schema)
 248     validator(document)
 249 
 250     assert 'foo' in validator.document_error_tree
 251     assert 'bar' in validator.document_error_tree['foo']
 252     assert 'foo' in validator.schema_error_tree
 253     assert 'schema' in validator.schema_error_tree['foo']
 254 
 255     assert errors.MAPPING_SCHEMA in validator.document_error_tree['foo'].errors
 256     assert errors.MAPPING_SCHEMA in validator.document_error_tree['foo']
 257     assert errors.BAD_TYPE in validator.document_error_tree['foo']['bar']
 258     assert errors.MAPPING_SCHEMA in validator.schema_error_tree['foo']['schema']
 259     assert (
 260         errors.BAD_TYPE in validator.schema_error_tree['foo']['schema']['bar']['type']
 261     )
 262 
 263     assert (
 264         validator.document_error_tree['foo'][errors.MAPPING_SCHEMA].child_errors[0].code
 265         == errors.BAD_TYPE.code
 266     )
 267 
 268 
 269 def test_basic_error_handler():
 270     handler = errors.BasicErrorHandler()
 271     _errors, ref = [], {}
 272 
 273     _errors.append(ValidationError(['foo'], ['foo'], 0x63, 'readonly', True, None, ()))
 274     ref.update({'foo': [handler.messages[0x63]]})
 275     assert handler(_errors) == ref
 276 
 277     _errors.append(ValidationError(['bar'], ['foo'], 0x42, 'min', 1, 2, ()))
 278     ref.update({'bar': [handler.messages[0x42].format(constraint=1)]})
 279     assert handler(_errors) == ref
 280 
 281     _errors.append(
 282         ValidationError(
 283             ['zap', 'foo'], ['zap', 'schema', 'foo'], 0x24, 'type', 'string', True, ()
 284         )
 285     )
 286     ref.update({'zap': [{'foo': [handler.messages[0x24].format(constraint='string')]}]})
 287     assert handler(_errors) == ref
 288 
 289     _errors.append(
 290         ValidationError(
 291             ['zap', 'foo'],
 292             ['zap', 'schema', 'foo'],
 293             0x41,
 294             'regex',
 295             '^p[e]ng$',
 296             'boom',
 297             (),
 298         )
 299     )
 300     ref['zap'][0]['foo'].append(handler.messages[0x41].format(constraint='^p[e]ng$'))
 301     assert handler(_errors) == ref
 302 
 303 
 304 def test_basic_error_of_errors(validator):
 305     schema = {'foo': {'oneof': [{'type': 'integer'}, {'type': 'string'}]}}
 306     document = {'foo': 23.42}
 307     error = ('foo', ('foo', 'oneof'), errors.ONEOF, schema['foo']['oneof'], ())
 308     child_errors = [
 309         (error[0], error[1] + (0, 'type'), errors.BAD_TYPE, 'integer'),
 310         (error[0], error[1] + (1, 'type'), errors.BAD_TYPE, 'string'),
 311     ]
 312     assert_fail(
 313         document, schema, validator=validator, error=error, child_errors=child_errors
 314     )
 315     assert validator.errors == {
 316         'foo': [
 317             errors.BasicErrorHandler.messages[0x92],
 318             {
 319                 'oneof definition 0': ['must be of integer type'],
 320                 'oneof definition 1': ['must be of string type'],
 321             },
 322         ]
 323     }
 324 
 325 
 326 def test_wrong_amount_of_items(validator):
 327     # https://github.com/pyeve/cerberus/issues/505
 328     validator.schema = {
 329         'test_list': {
 330             'type': 'list',
 331             'required': True,
 332             'items': [{'type': 'string'}, {'type': 'string'}],
 333         }
 334     }
 335     validator({'test_list': ['test']})
 336     assert validator.errors == {'test_list': ["length of list should be 2, it is 1"]}
